jobs.title: Operations Coordinator
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Bree

Bree is a consumer finance platform that brings better, faster, and cheaper financial services to over half the Canadian population who live paycheck to paycheck. We operate in a huge, but overlooked market in a country with the least amount of financial technology innovation in the developed world. Our first act is to become the cheapest and best provider of short-term credit to the 20 million people in Canada who live paycheck to paycheck. We are growing at a double-digit monthly rate and are profitable. We were part of Y Combinator in 2021 and raised a $2M seed round shortly after.

About the Role

Bree is looking for an organized, proactive, and versatile Operations Coordinator to be the backbone of our growing team.

In this pivotal cross-functional role, you'll ensure seamless day-to-day operations across people, culture, and special projects, with a strong emphasis on operational excellence and supporting data visibility. You will serve as a key operational and administrative support resource for the executive team, directly contributing to our operational efficiency and hyper-growth environment. You'll anticipate needs, drive efficiency, and maintain a highly functional and engaged team.

This is a full-time, 5 days per week in-office role based at our office at Yonge/Bloor in Toronto.

What You'll Do

  • Business Operations & Reporting: Support decision-making by tracking key operational metrics, assisting with routine data reporting, and ensuring the executive team has timely visibility into performance and processes.

  • Operational Excellence: Drive internal efficiency by identifying and implementing process improvements and maintaining internal documentation systems.

  • People Operations & Culture: Support the employee lifecycle, from recruitment and seamless onboarding/offboarding to organizing engaging team culture activities.

  • Special Projects & Ad Hoc Initiatives: Respond promptly to ad-hoc requests and drive various cross-functional projects, or researching and preparing proposals for new projects.

  • Executive Administration: Manage the executive office's needs, from coordinating challenging calendars and travel to overseeing all office operations (procurement, supplies, and facility upkeep) and organizing company event logistics.

What You'll Need

  • Proven experience in an operations, administrative, or executive support role, preferably within a fast-paced startup.

  • Exceptional organizational skills and a meticulous attention to detail, capable of managing complex administrative needs and multiple priorities simultaneously.

  • Demonstrated ability to identify inefficiencies, proactively implement process improvements, and support basic data collection/reporting.

  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact professionally with all team members.

  • Proficiency with modern workplace tools for documentation (e.g., Slack, Google Workspace) and administrative tasks, and comfort working with data/metrics in spreadsheets.

  • A proactive, solutions-oriented mindset with the ability to anticipate needs and drive projects autonomously.

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package

  • $250 monthly lunch stipend

  • Comprehensive health, dental, and vision coverage

  • Parental leave

  • Unlimited PTO

jobs.title: Internship Program (All Roles)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Bree

Bree is a consumer finance platform that brings better, faster, and cheaper financial services to over half the Canadian population who live paycheck to paycheck. We operate in a huge, but overlooked market in a country with the least amount of financial technology innovation in the developed world. Our first act is to become the cheapest and best provider of short-term credit to the 20 million people in Canada who live paycheck to paycheck.

More than half a million Canadians have already signed up with Bree, and we believe we are just scratching the surface. We are in an exciting place where we have product market fit, explosive growth, and a clear path to becoming one of the most important FinTechs in Canada.

We have $5M ARR per full-time engineer, growing at a double-digit monthly rate, profitable, and have had 0 voluntary employee churn. We were part of Y Combinator in 2021 and raised a $2M seed round shortly after.

About the Internship

Bree is on a mission to build the best AI-native team across engineering, product, design, operations, and marketing. Our internship program is designed to give you the chance to explore impactful projects across multiple functions while working alongside some of the best minds in FinTech.

Instead of limiting you to one department, we’ll match you to opportunities based on your skills, interests, and career goals. You’ll have the chance to contribute directly to building products, solving hard problems, and shaping the future of consumer finance in Canada.

What You'll Do

Depending on your team and interests, you may:

  • Engineering: Contribute to scalable systems, build new features, and leverage AI tools to ship faster and smarter.

  • Product & Design: Support user research, design experiments, and help create intuitive financial products.

  • Marketing & Growth: Run campaigns, experiment with new channels, and analyze data to drive user acquisition.

  • Operations & Strategy: Improve processes, support customer success, and help scale Bree’s internal systems.

Across all roles, you’ll:

  • Take ownership of real projects from day one.

  • Collaborate with teammates across multiple disciplines.

  • Learn and apply cutting-edge tools, including AI-first workflows.

  • Gain experience in a hyper-growth, high-performance startup environment.

What We're Looking For

  • Current student or recent graduate in any field (all majors welcome).

  • Curious, adaptable, and motivated to learn quickly.

  • Strong communicator who enjoys solving problems in teams.

  • Excited about FinTech, AI, and building for millions of users.

  • A self-starter who thrives in fast-paced, high-growth environments.

Benefits

  • Hands-on experience with meaningful projects.

  • Mentorship and guidance from a high-performing team.

  • Exposure to multiple roles and career paths.

  • A chance to convert into a full-time role after your internship.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Backend
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Bree

Bree is a consumer finance platform that brings better, faster, and cheaper financial services to over half the Canadian population who live paycheck to paycheck. We operate in a huge, but overlooked market in a country with the least amount of financial technology innovation in the developed world. Our first act is to become the cheapest and best provider of short-term credit to the 20 million people in Canada who live paycheck to paycheck.

More than half a million Canadians have already signed up with Bree, and we believe we are just scratching the surface. We are in an exciting place where we have product market fit, explosive growth, and a clear path to becoming one of the most important FinTechs in Canada.

We have $5M ARR per full-time engineer, growing at a double-digit monthly rate, profitable, and have had 0 voluntary employee churn. We were part of Y Combinator in 2021 and raised a $2M seed round shortly after.

About the Role

Bree is on a mission to build the best AI native engineering team. Our ideal candidate has a deep understanding of modern backend systems and software architecture and enjoys leveraging AI tools to ship efficiently and reliably. Read more about AI native engineering teams here.

What You'll Do

  • Architect and implement scalable event-driven microservices using modern protocols like gRPC to handle high-throughput financial transactions with sub-millisecond latency.

  • Design backend systems integrating TypeScript with PostgreSQL, while incorporating Go or Rust for performance-critical components in a regulated FinTech environment.

  • Leverage AI tools such as Claude Code and Cursor to automate test-driven development, accelerating feature delivery in a hyper-growth startup.

  • Own end-to-end system reliability, including observability, fault-tolerant design, and seamless scaling to support millions of users.

What You'll Need

  • Proven expertise in building distributed systems with event sourcing or CQRS patterns, ideally in high-stakes domains like finance or e-commerce.

  • Mastery of modern backend stacks, including gRPC, message queues (e.g., Kafka), and cloud-native tools, with strong TypeScript and PostgreSQL skills; Go/Rust experience a plus.

  • Strong architectural thinking to solve ambiguous problems in fast-paced settings, with a track record of scaling systems under explosive growth.

  • Exceptional collaboration and communication skills, thriving in low-churn teams focused on excellence and innovation.

Benefits

  • Top of the market compensation for top performers

  • $1,500 annual learning stipend

  • $1,000 annual wellness stipend

  • $250 monthly lunch stipend

  • Comprehensive insurance coverage

  • 2 annual company retreats

  • Parental leave

  • Unlimited PTO

jobs.title: Lifecycle Marketer (Contract)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Bree

Bree is a consumer finance platform that brings better, faster, and cheaper financial services to over half the Canadian population who live paycheck to paycheck. We operate in a huge but overlooked market. Our first act is becoming the cheapest and best provider of short-term credit to the 20 million people in Canada who live paycheck to paycheck.

More than 400,000 Canadians have already signed up with Bree and we believe we are just scratching the surface. We are in an exciting place where we have product-market fit, explosive growth, and a clear path to becoming one of the most important fintech companies in Canada.

We have 8-figures of annualized revenue, double-digit monthly growth, profitability, and had 0 voluntary employee churn. We were part of Y Combinator in 2021 and raised a $2M seed round shortly after.

About the Role

We're looking for a strategic Contract Lifecycle Marketer to build and optimize our customer communication journeys. You'll be responsible for setting up, managing, and analyzing automated campaigns within Customer.io to drive user engagement, retention, and key financial actions. You'll play a critical role in how we communicate with our users at every step of their journey.

What You’ll Do

  • Design and implement end-to-end customer journeys and campaigns in Customer.io across channels like email, SMS, and push notifications.

  • Write clear, compelling, and on-brand copy for all lifecycle marketing communications.

  • Strategically segment our user base to deliver highly personalized and relevant messages.

  • Execute A/B tests on subject lines, creative, and timing to continuously improve performance.

  • Analyze campaign results and key metrics (e.g., open rates, click-through rates, conversion) to identify opportunities for optimization.

  • Collaborate with product and data teams to define key customer events and triggers for automation.

  • Maintain an organized and well-documented library of templates, audiences, and journey logic.

What You’ll Need

  • Demonstrated experience in lifecycle marketing and marketing automation.

  • Direct, hands-on experience setting up journeys and campaigns in Customer.io is a must.

  • Experience working in a B2C consumer fintech, lending, or similar industry is a strong plus.

  • Strong copywriting skills with a proven ability to write for different channels and audiences.

  • An analytical mindset with experience in A/B testing and performance reporting.

  • Exceptional project management skills to manage multiple campaigns and deadlines.

  • A solid understanding of data segmentation and how to use it to create personalized user experiences.

  • Familiarity with HTML and CSS for minor template adjustments is a plus.

WHAT YOU’LL NEED

jobs.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Bree

Bree is a consumer finance platform that brings better, faster, and cheaper financial services to over half the Canadian population who live paycheck to paycheck. We operate in a huge, but overlooked market in a country with the least amount of financial technology innovation in the developed world. Our first act is to become the cheapest and best provider of short-term credit to the 20 million people in Canada who live paycheck to paycheck.

More than half a million Canadians have already signed up with Bree, and we believe we are just scratching the surface. We are in an exciting place where we have product market fit, explosive growth, and a clear path to becoming one of the most important FinTechs in Canada.

We have $5M ARR per full-time engineer, growing at a double-digit monthly rate, profitable, and have had 0 voluntary employee churn. We were part of Y Combinator in 2021 and raised a $2M seed round shortly after.

About the Role

Bree is on a mission to build the best AI native engineering team. Our ideal Machine Learning Engineer has a deep understanding of modern ML systems and deploying models at scale in production environments. You'll enjoy leveraging AI tools to iterate quickly on models, experiment with cutting-edge techniques, and deliver high-impact solutions efficiently and reliably. Read more about AI native engineering teams here.

What You'll Do

  • Design, train, and deploy scalable machine learning models for critical FinTech applications, including credit risk assessment, fraud detection, and personalized financial recommendations, using frameworks like PyTorch and LightGBM.

  • Architect ML pipelines integrating with backend systems to process high-throughput data streams with low-latency inference for real-time decision-making.

  • Leverage AI tools to automate experimentation, hyperparameter tuning, and test-driven ML development, accelerating the delivery of robust, production-ready models.

  • Own the full ML lifecycle, including feature engineering, model evaluation, A/B testing, monitoring for drift, and seamless scaling to support explosive user growth while ensuring compliance with financial regulations.

  • Experiment with advanced techniques in deep learning and reinforcement learning to push the boundaries of what's possible in consumer finance.

  • Mentor junior team members and contribute to a culture of innovation, sharing insights from competitive ML experiences (e.g., Kaggle competitions, research publications) to elevate the team's capabilities.

What You'll Need

  • Proven expertise in building and deploying production ML systems and handling imbalanced datasets in high-stakes domains like finance or e-commerce.

  • Mastery of traditional ML systems and modern deep learning/reinforcement learning architectures, with a track record of applying them to real-world problems.

  • Competitive ML experience (e.g., top rankings in Kaggle, NeurIPS challenges, or open-source contributions) is a bonus, demonstrating your ability to innovate under constraints and deliver high-performance models.

  • Architectural thinking to solve ambiguous, data-driven problems in fast-paced settings, with experience scaling ML systems under explosive growth while maintaining accuracy, fairness, and explainability.

  • Exceptional collaboration and communication skills, including the ability to explain complex ML concepts to non-technical stakeholders, thriving in low-churn teams focused on excellence, ethical AI, and long-term impact.

  • A passion for FinTech and consumer impact, with a bias toward action and a history of shipping ML features that drive measurable results, such as improved accuracy in credit decisions or reduced fraud losses.

Benefits

  • Top of the market compensation for top performers

  • $1,500 annual learning stipend

  • $1,000 annual wellness stipend

  • $250 monthly lunch stipend

  • Comprehensive insurance coverage

  • 2 annual company retreats

  • Parental leave

  • Unlimited PTO

 - Proven expertise in building and deploying production ML systems and handling imbalanced datasets in high-stakes domains like finance or e-commerce.

BENEFITS

 - Top of the market compensation for top performers

 - $1,500 annual learning stipend

 - $1,000 annual wellness stipend

 - $250 monthly lunch stipend

 - Comprehensive insurance coverage

 - 2 annual company retreats

 - Parental leave

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Bree

Bree is a consumer finance platform that brings better, faster, and cheaper financial services to over half the Canadian population who live paycheck to paycheck. We operate in a huge, but overlooked market in a country with the least amount of financial technology innovation in the developed world. Our first act is to become the cheapest and best provider of short-term credit to the 20 million people in Canada who live paycheck to paycheck.

More than half a million Canadians have already signed up with Bree, and we believe we are just scratching the surface. We are in an exciting place where we have product market fit, explosive growth, and a clear path to becoming one of the most important FinTechs in Canada.

We have $5M ARR per full-time engineer, growing at a double-digit monthly rate, profitable, and have had 0 voluntary employee churn. We were part of Y Combinator in 2021 and raised a $2M seed round shortly after.

About the Role

Bree is on a mission to build the best AI native engineering team. Ideal candidates have a deep understanding of modern data stack and use AI tools for efficient, reliable delivery. Read more about AI native engineering teams here.

You’ll be at the intersection of product, engineering, and growth, shaping how we make decisions, measure performance, and scale data infrastructure to support millions of Canadians.

What You'll Do

  • Conduct deep-dive analyses to uncover user behaviours, friction points, and growth opportunities.

  • Design and analyze A/B tests to optimize user experience and conversion rates.

  • Develop and maintain high-leverage dashboards and self-serve reporting tools for product and business teams.

  • Leverage statistics and machine learning to provide predictive insights and enhance personalization.

  • Help build and maintain a unified data warehouse that supports both operational and analytical use cases.

What You'll Need

  • Proficiency in SQL and Python, with a track record of building clean, reusable analytical code.

  • Familiarity with experimentation frameworks, causal inference, and statistical modelling.

  • Strong data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (e.g. Metabase and Streamlit).

  • Exceptional collaboration and communication skills, thriving in low-churn teams focused on excellence and innovation.

Benefits

  • Top of the market compensation for top performers

  • $1,500 annual learning stipend

  • $1,000 annual wellness stipend

  • $250 monthly lunch stipend

  • Comprehensive insurance coverage

  • 2 annual company retreats

  • Parental leave

  • Unlimited PTO

ABOUT THE ROLE

Bree is on a mission to build the best AI native engineering team. Ideal candidates have a deep understanding of modern data stack and use AI tools for efficient, reliable delivery. Read more about AI native engineering teams here https://blog.nilenso.com/blog/2025/05/29/ai-assisted-coding/.

You’ll be at the intersection of product, engineering, and growth, shaping how we make decisions, measure performance, and scale data infrastructure to support millions of Canadians.





WHAT YOU'LL DO

 - Conduct deep-dive analyses to uncover user behaviours, friction points, and growth opportunities.

 - Design and analyze A/B tests to optimize user experience and conversion rates.

 - Develop and maintain high-leverage dashboards and self-serve reporting tools for product and business teams.

 - Leverage statistics and machine learning to provide predictive insights and enhance personalization.

 - Help build and maintain a unified data warehouse that supports both operational and analytical use cases.


WHAT YOU'LL NEED

 - Proficiency in SQL and Python, with a track record of building clean, reusable analytical code.

 - Familiarity with experimentation frameworks, causal inference, and statistical modelling.

 - Strong data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (e.g. Metabase and Streamlit).

 - Exceptional collaboration and communication skills, thriving in low-churn teams focused on excellence and innovation.


BENEFITS

 - Top of the market compensation for top performers

 - $1,500 annual learning stipend

 - $1,000 annual wellness stipend

 - $250 monthly lunch stipend

 - Comprehensive insurance coverage

 - 2 annual company retreats

 - Parental leave

 - Unlimited PTO

compensation.compensationTierSummary: CA$80K – CA$130K • Offers Equity • Offers Bonus

compensationTiers.tierSummary: Base Salary CA$80K – CA$130K • Offers Equity • Offers Bonus

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Mobile
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Bree

Bree is a consumer finance platform that brings better, faster, and cheaper financial services to over half the Canadian population who live paycheck to paycheck. We operate in a huge, but overlooked market in a country with the least amount of financial technology innovation in the developed world. Our first act is to become the cheapest and best provider of short-term credit to the 20 million people in Canada who live paycheck to paycheck.

More than half a million Canadians have already signed up with Bree, and we believe we are just scratching the surface. We are in an exciting place where we have product market fit, explosive growth, and a clear path to becoming one of the most important FinTechs in Canada.

We have $5M ARR per full-time engineer, growing at a double-digit monthly rate, profitable, and have had 0 voluntary employee churn. We were part of Y Combinator in 2021 and raised a $2M seed round shortly after.

About the Role

Bree is on a mission to build the best AI native engineering team. Our ideal candidate has a deep understanding of modern mobile development and cross-platform architectures, with a focus on React Native and Expo, and enjoys leveraging AI tools to ship high-quality apps efficiently and reliably. Read more about AI native engineering teams here.

What You'll Do

  • Design and implement intuitive, performant mobile features using React Native and Expo to deliver seamless user experiences for financial services, handling complex state management and offline capabilities.

  • Architect cross-platform mobile apps that integrate with backend APIs, optimizing for battery life, network efficiency, and real-time updates in a high-throughput FinTech environment.

  • Leverage AI tools such as Claude Code and Cursor to automate UI/UX prototyping, testing, and code generation, accelerating app iterations and deployments in a hyper-growth startup.

  • Own end-to-end mobile app reliability, including CI/CD pipelines, crash reporting, and A/B testing to support millions of users across iOS and Android.

  • Collaborate on app store submissions, performance tuning, and feature roadmaps, ensuring rapid shipping of updates while maintaining security and compliance standards.

What You'll Need

  • Proven track record of shipping consumer-facing mobile apps to production using React Native and Expo, with experience in scaling to large user bases.

  • Mastery of modern mobile stacks, including React Native, Expo Router, state management (e.g., Redux or MobX), and native modules; familiarity with TypeScript and performance optimization tools a plus.

  • Strong architectural thinking to tackle ambiguous mobile challenges, such as cross-device compatibility and accessibility, in fast-paced environments with explosive growth.

  • Exceptional problem-solving skills in debugging complex mobile issues, with a history of contributing to open-source projects or leading app refactorings.

  • Outstanding collaboration and communication abilities, excelling in low-churn teams that prioritize innovation, code quality, and user-centric design.

Benefits

  • Top of the market compensation for top performers

  • $1,500 annual learning stipend

  • $1,000 annual wellness stipend

  • $250 monthly lunch stipend

  • Comprehensive insurance coverage

  • 2 annual company retreats

  • Parental leave

  • Unlimited PTO

jobs.title: Software Engineer, New Graduate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Bree

Bree is a consumer finance platform that brings better, faster, and cheaper financial services to over half the Canadian population who live paycheck to paycheck. We operate in a huge, but overlooked market in a country with the least amount of financial technology innovation in the developed world. Our first act is to become the cheapest and best provider of short-term credit to the 20 million people in Canada who live paycheck to paycheck.

More than half a million Canadians have already signed up with Bree, and we believe we are just scratching the surface. We are in an exciting place where we have product market fit, explosive growth, and a clear path to becoming one of the most important FinTechs in Canada.

We have $5M ARR per full-time engineer, growing at a double-digit monthly rate, profitable, and have had 0 voluntary employee churn. We were part of Y Combinator in 2021 and raised a $2M seed round shortly after.

About the Role

Bree is on a mission to build the best AI native engineering team. As a new graduate joining us in 2026, you'll be part of a high-growth environment where you'll learn to build scalable systems while leveraging AI tools to accelerate your development and problem-solving. Our ideal candidate is a smart, high-potential recent grad who is AI native, comfortable integrating AI into their workflow to ship code efficiently and reliably. Read more about AI native engineering teams here.

What You'll Do

  • Contribute to building scalable backend systems to handle high-throughput financial transactions in a fast-paced FinTech startup.

  • Collaborate on designing and implementing features, incorporating AI tools to automate testing and speed up development cycles.

  • Help ensure system reliability through monitoring, debugging, and scaling efforts to support a growing user base.

  • Work closely with the team to solve real-world problems, learning best practices in software engineering along the way.

What You'll Need

  • A strong foundation in computer science fundamentals, such as data structures, algorithms, and software design, ideally demonstrated through academic projects, internships, or personal initiatives.

  • Enthusiasm for backend development and an eagerness to learn modern tools and practices in a regulated environment.

  • Familiarity with or interest in using AI tools to enhance coding efficiency and innovation.

  • Excellent problem-solving skills, a growth mindset, and the ability to collaborate in a supportive, low-churn team focused on excellence.

Benefits

  • Top of the market compensation for top performers

  • $1,500 annual learning stipend

  • $1,000 annual wellness stipend

  • $250 monthly lunch stipend

  • Comprehensive insurance coverage

  • 2 annual company retreats

  • Parental leave

  • Unlimited PTO

jobs.title: Technical Project Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Bree

Bree is a consumer finance platform that brings better, faster, and cheaper financial services to over half the Canadian population who live paycheck to paycheck. We operate in a huge, but overlooked market in a country with the least amount of financial technology innovation in the developed world. Our first act is to become the cheapest and best provider of short-term credit to the 20 million people in Canada who live paycheck to paycheck.

More than half a million Canadians have already signed up with Bree, and we believe we are just scratching the surface. We are in an exciting place where we have product market fit, explosive growth, and a clear path to becoming one of the most important FinTechs in Canada.

We have over $6M ARR per full-time engineer, growing at a double-digit monthly rate, profitable, and have had 0 voluntary employee churn. We were part of Y Combinator in 2021 and raised a $2M seed round shortly after.

About the Role

Bree is on a mission to build the best AI native engineering team. Our ideal candidate thrives at the intersection of technology, process, and product delivery. Read more about AI native engineering teams here.

What You'll Do

  • Partner with the Head of Engineering and product leads to plan and execute high-impact initiatives, ensuring smooth delivery from concept to deployment.

  • Manage system-level projects across backend services, data pipelines, and integrations in a regulated FinTech environment.

  • Leverage AI tools like Claude Code and Cursor to streamline project documentation, QA tracking, and sprint planning.

  • Define and maintain technical roadmaps, ensuring architecture decisions, scaling strategies, and performance goals are aligned with company milestones.

  • Drive cross-functional communication, proactively identifying risks, dependencies, and opportunities for automation.

  • Champion observability, reliability, and resilience across all projects, ensuring uptime and scalability for millions of users.

What You'll Need

  • Strong background in technical project or program management, ideally within FinTech, SaaS, or high-growth startups.

  • Deep understanding of backend systems, distributed architectures, and event-driven design. You don’t need to code daily, but you can diagram and debate system trade-offs with engineers.

  • Familiarity with modern engineering stacks (TypeScript, PostgreSQL, gRPC, Kafka, Go/Rust) and cloud-native deployment practices.

  • Proven ability to deliver complex software projects on time by aligning priorities across technical and non-technical teams.

  • Exceptional clarity in communication, documentation, and process thinking.

  • Comfort operating in high-autonomy, low-hierarchy environments where speed and precision matter.

Benefits

  • Top of the market compensation for top performers

  • $1,500 annual learning stipend

  • $1,000 annual wellness stipend

  • $250 monthly lunch stipend

  • Comprehensive insurance coverage

  • 2 annual company retreats

  • Parental leave

  • Unlimited PTO

jobs.title: Senior Data Scientist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Bree

Bree is a consumer finance platform that brings better, faster, and cheaper financial services to over half the Canadian population who live paycheck to paycheck. We operate in a huge, but overlooked market in a country with the least amount of financial technology innovation in the developed world. Our first act is to become the cheapest and best provider of short-term credit to the 20 million people in Canada who live paycheck to paycheck.

More than half a million Canadians have already signed up with Bree, and we believe we are just scratching the surface. We are in an exciting place where we have product market fit, explosive growth, and a clear path to becoming one of the most important FinTechs in Canada.

We have $5M ARR per full-time engineer, growing at a double-digit monthly rate, profitable, and have had 0 voluntary employee churn. We were part of Y Combinator in 2021 and raised a $2M seed round shortly after.

About the Role

Bree is on a mission to build the best AI native engineering team. Ideal candidates have a deep understanding of the modern data stack and use AI tools for efficient, reliable delivery. Read more about AI native engineering teams here.

You’ll be at the intersection of product, engineering, and growth, shaping how we make decisions, measure performance, and scale data infrastructure to support millions of Canadians.

What you’ll do

  • Own the experimentation strategy by designing A/B and sequential tests, setting guardrails such as power analysis, SRM checks, and CUPED, and introducing bandits when appropriate.

  • Build and ship personalization, ranking, and forecasting models—recommenders, propensity, churn and LTV that measurably improve activation, conversion, and retention.

  • Translate deep-dive analyses into product changes by defining success metrics and counterfactuals and partnering with Product and Engineering to deliver impact.

  • Architect a modern data platform by shaping the warehouse and feature store with robust schemas, data contracts, SLAs, and governance for both operational and analytical use cases.

  • Support the ML lifecycle from problem framing and data acquisition to feature pipelines, training, evaluation, deployment, monitoring, and retraining.

What you’ll need

  • Expert SQL and Python with clean, modular, well-tested code and fluency across the PyData and ML stack (pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, XGBoost or LightGBM, and deep learning as needed).

  • Depth in experimentation and causal inference covering A/B design and analysis, sequential testing, CUPED, difference-in-differences, and uplift modelling with sound identification judgment.

  • Strong product sense to turn ambiguity into measurable objectives, define North Star and guardrail metrics, and communicate trade-offs to executives and cross-functional partners.

  • Proficiency in data visualization and BI tools such as Metabase and Streamlit, with storytelling that drives decisions rather than merely producing dashboards.

  • Modern data platform and engineering rigour, including dbt and BigQuery, Snowflake, or Spark; familiarity with feature stores and real-time inference; and disciplined practices in version control, reviews, typing and tests, and secure cloud deployments.

Benefits

  • Top of the market compensation for top performers

  • $1,500 annual learning stipend

  • $1,000 annual wellness stipend

  • $250 monthly lunch stipend

  • Comprehensive insurance coverage

  • 2 annual company retreats

  • Parental leave

  • Unlimited PTO

jobs.title: Creative Strategist (Part-Time)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Bree

Bree is a consumer finance platform that brings better, faster, and cheaper financial services to over half the Canadian population who live paycheck to paycheck. We operate in a huge but overlooked market. Our first act is becoming the cheapest and best provider of short-term credit to the 20 million people in Canada who live paycheck to paycheck. More than 400,000 Canadians have already signed up with Bree and we believe we are just scratching the surface. We are in an exciting place where we have product-market fit, explosive growth, and a clear path to becoming one of the most important fintech companies in Canada.

We have 8-figures of annualized revenue, double-digit monthly growth, profitability, and had 0 voluntary employee churn. We were part of Y Combinator in 2021 and raised a $2M seed round shortly after.

About the Role

We’re looking for a nimble Creative Producer to turbo-charge our ad pipeline. You’ll partner with our Creative Strategist to transform ideas into production-ready briefs and own delivery of content from concept to launch—delivering more high-impact Bree ads, faster.

What You’ll Do

  • Draft and refine production-ready creative briefs (concept, deliverables, specs, deadlines) across UGC, statics, motions, etc

  • Source and onboard creators who align with Bree’s mission and audience.

  • Project-manage each ad from ideation through edits, ensuring on-brand output and rapid turnaround.

  • Maintain an organized asset library of references, scripts, and finished ads.

  • Collaborate with the Creative Strategist to iterate on winning hooks and retire under-performers.

  • Liaise with Growth to track creative performance and feed insights back into new briefs.

  • Uphold Bree’s brand guidelines and compliance requirements across all creator content.

What You’ll Need

  • High attention to detail and pride in your work - the devil is in the details of iteration

  • Strong project-management chops; you keep multiple productions moving on tight deadlines.

  • Familiarity with UGC best practices: vertical 9 : 16, 12-25 s runtime, safe-zone text, natural lighting, clear audio.

  • Comfort reviewing edits in tools like Frame.io, Dropbox Replay, or similar.

  • Excellent written communication and a knack for friendly, empowering brand voices.

Compensation

$40/hr, 5-10 hours per week
